review: Excellent delivery, offering as many, if not more choices than cable. You don't need a Smart TV with the Fire Stick. Saving hundreds of dollars while adding comfort and ease to your television viewing.
author: Don Bouie

review: I have to say I was very excited when I first heard about the Amazon Fire TV Stick.  I wanted a device that I could stream both Netflix and Amazon Prime Videos, which my Chromecast could not do, plus the Fire TV Stick came with remote.  I ordered it shortly after it was released but due to the high demand the Fire TV Stick was back ordered.  I am happy to say that our Fire TV Stick  arrived earlier than our expected delivery date (by about a month).  We quickly set up the Fire TV Stick by following the easy to use instructions included with the device and within minutes I was streaming movies from both services.  Everything worked great for the first few weeks, no buffering of videos or dropping of network connection which I would often experience with my Chromecast.  After about a month of use, we had an issue with movie playback (sound only on a blue screen).  I called the Amazon customer support number and quickly had the issue resolved by resetting the device and adding the supplied HMDI extension cord.  Since then we have only had minor playback issues, which are most likely related to our poor internet service provider's wifi router.  I actually want to buy a second Fire TV Stick for our second TV so I don't have to switch it from room to room.Pros:Ability to stream video from both Netflix and Amazon Prime VideosRemoteEase of setupAbility to play video games from device (can purchase a game controller separately)Cons:A few bugs with playback as mentioned above (none recently)

review: I have a "smart" bluray player and it's so clumsy and annoying to find anything on there. I was going to buy the newest Fire TV with the voice remote when I realized by downloading the app I can use my phone as the remote and have the same experience. (I won't be using the games.) I love that Fire TV also notifies me if something I want to watch is available elsewhere-- like the other system I considered, the Roku, although that's  only avail for certain apps. Love it!
